detaileddescription.para: Type by which queue sets are referenced. For example, a call to xQueueCreateSet() returns an xQueueSet variable that can then be used as a parameter to xQueueSelectFromSet(), xQueueAddToSet(), etc.

Queue sets can contain both queues and semaphores, so the QueueSetMemberHandle_t is defined as a type to be used where a parameter or return value can be either an QueueHandle_t or an SemaphoreHandle_t.

memberdef.argsstring: (QueueHandle_t xQueue, const void *const pvItemToQueue, TickType_t xTicksToWait, const BaseType_t xCopyPosition) PRIVILEGED_FUNCTION
